name: OneBusAway Alexa
tagline: An Java-based app to communicate with Amazon Alexa for devices such as the Amazon Echo
body:
### Arrival information at your command
Say _Alexa, where's my bus?_, and quickly get real-time arrival information for your favorite bus stop.

### Around the world
Available anywhere OneBusAway is deployed, including:
* Atlanta, GA
* Rogue Valley, OR
* San Diego, CA 
* Seattle/Tacoma/Puget Sound, WA
* Tampa Bay, FL
* Washington, D.C.
* York (Canada)

### More about OneBusAway
Check out the [main OneBusAway website](http://onebusaway.org/) for more information about the project.

### Authors and Contributors
Created by Sean J. Barbeau (@barbeau) and Philip M. White (philipmw).  Licensed under [Apache v2.0](http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0).

### Support or Contact
Having trouble? Check out our [documentation](https://github.com/OneBusAway/onebusaway-alexa/wiki/Finding-your-stop-number) or contact us at alexa@onebusaway.org and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
